items.text: Introduced to Computer Science and wrote my first "Hello world" program on a Raspberry Pi. Sparked my first interest in the subject.
Started my GCSE Computer Science course with a very inspirational teacher. Also started to proactively learn programming in Python in my freetime through Youtube and Codeacademy.
Learned about assembly and how a computer runs a program via the Little Man Computer. Also wrote an averaging function in this simulator.
Learned Pygame and made 3 games with it.
Learned Arduino and built a temperature and light sensor with a custom coded live graph of the data.
Built an advanced version of Pong in Pygame for my A-level project. Also wrote a full technical document for it.
Learned HTML, CSS and Javascript as well as Git, Github and Microsoft Azure in preparation for a University Assignment.
Built and hosted a website in a team university assignment
Learned C# and Unity in order to work as a team to build an AR game for University Assignment.
Intrigued by Machine learning as a concept and began researching about how it works and how it's used.
Worked on a machine learning project and report to predict Premier League match results.
Worked on a Virtual reality team project with the Microsoft Kinect.
Learned about some of my favourite topics namely: Computer Graphics, Image Processing and Machine Learning.
Completed my Software Engineering internship at FactSet, in which I got a job offer.
Did some very interesting modules about Deep learning and Machine Vision which was very enjoyable and challenging to learn.
Did a University VR project on the Oculus Quest 2 with a team.
Did a University Natural Language Processing project with a team.
Did my final year Master's Project and Thesis.
Worked on and finished a relatively large personal project which was a programming language and IDE.
